titlestmt.titleproper: Rosemyrtle McLaughlin General Tire and Rubber Company photographic collection, Inclusive: 1957-1986, undated, Bulk: 1959-1983, undated

note.p: © 2021 The Texas Collection. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Finding Aid was generated by The Texas Collection staff, using the STAR Knowledge Center for Archives (SKCA) task that automatically creates EAD files from the Archive's SKCA catalog records.

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Rosemyrtle McLaughlin General Tire and Rubber Company photographic collection
did.abstract: The Rosemyrtle McLaughlin General Tire and Rubber Company photographic collection includes Rosemyrtle McLaughlin's collected administrative files and photographs from the General Tire plant.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: Rosemyrtle McLaughlin worked in the Order and Traffic office of the General Tire and Rubber Company in Waco. It is not known when she began working there or how long she worked.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Rosemyrtle McLaughlin General Tire and Rubber Company photographic collection includes three folders of administrative files and two folders of photographs from the Order and Traffic office of General Tire and Rubber Company. The collection materials show the operations of the plant, mostly through employee directories, from 1957 until its close in 1985.

In total, there are 5 interior photographs of the plant, 1 aerial photograph and 4 unidentified photographs of unknown locations. Only three of the plant photographs are dated, of which two are identified. Identified individuals include Roger Knudson and David Neal; the aerial photograph includes the notation ‘Taken Aug. or Sept. 1970 per Mr. Cape’ and ‘Received because of Fair Share contribution 1972’. The photographer and studio who produced these photographs are unknown but the photographs themselves are in excellent condition; there is some adhesive on the back but there are no tears or other damage.

The General Tire and Rubber Company opened in Waco in 1944 November as the first major tire factory in the southwest. In 1946, members of the Congress of Industrial Organization led a strike at the plant that lasted at least 60 days; the strikers demanded higher wages to meet the rising cost of living after World War II. At its height, the plant occupied a 2 million square-foot facility and employed over 1,500 workers. After several decades of successful business, the plant became obsolete and tire production was phased out in 1986; layoffs lasted for several years. The General Tire headquarters in Akron, Ohio, eventually closed as well and became a subsidiary of Continental General Tire, based in Hannover, Germany. Over the years, the Waco plant building retained the name General Tire, but was divided for use among various companies, including Clarke Products and Caterpillar Logistics. In 2010, Baylor Research & Innovation Collaboration renovated portions of the General Tire building. It was then donated to Baylor University.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Prior to current processing, all of the materials in the collection were in a three ring binder with no apparent order. There were no existing finding aids or inventories. As a result, administrative files and photographs were placed in folders with titles and dates reflecting their contents.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: All requests for copying of materials must be submitted to The Texas Collection in writing. Please use the Request Form for Copying Materials sheet. Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator (s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

userestrict.head: Use/Re-use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Rosemyrtle McLaughlin General Tire and Rubber Company photographic collection, Accession #3968, Box #, Folder #, The Texas Collection, Baylor University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Described by Casey Schumacher. Released on 2015-11-18.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: The General Tire and Rubber series includes administrative files and photographs collected from the General Tire Order and Traffic office.
